description: Map incidents triggered after battles (leaving_battle context)

events.title: Dead Man's Purse
events.setup: The battle is over. Bodies are scattered across the field. You notice a glint of gold on a corpse near your feet—someone's purse, spilled open. Officers aren't looking this way. No one would know.

options.resultText: You pocket the coins quickly, glancing around. No one saw. The weight feels heavier than it should.
You step over the body and move on. Some things aren't worth the risk—or the guilt.

options.text: Report the find to an officer
options.resultText: An officer nods and pockets the purse himself. He slips you a few coins for your honesty. 'Good soldier,' he mutters.

events.title: The Wounded Enemy
events.setup: A wounded enemy soldier lies in the mud, blood pooling beneath him. He's watching you, eyes wide with fear and pain. He's not dead yet. No one else is around.

options.resultText: You draw your blade and finish it quickly. Mercy or cruelty—you're not sure which. The field is quieter now.
You walk away. His labored breathing fades behind you. He might live, he might not. That's not your decision to make.
You signal for the surgeon's assistant. He looks at you oddly but comes over. 'Strange to waste bandages on them,' he says, but he does it anyway.

events.title: Battlefield Discovery
events.setup: While sifting through the aftermath, you notice something valuable half-buried in the mud—a well-crafted weapon, a noble's signet ring, or a pouch of foreign coin. It's worth more than a soldier's pay for a month.

options.resultText: You slip the item into your pack, covering it with a torn cloak. Your heart pounds, but no one saw. You hope.

options.text: Turn it in to the quartermaster
options.resultText: The quartermaster weighs the item in his hand, impressed. 'Honest work gets rewarded,' he says, and gives you a share of the value—less than it's worth, but clean coin.

options.text: Hide it and sell it in town later
options.resultText: You know a merchant who won't ask questions. You tuck the item away, planning your next visit to town. This could be profitable.
